name: places/ChIJvxusF-FYwokRjprPTZri-OQ
formattedAddress: 420 E 54th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 420 E 54th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: I had a great experience with the management office handling the apartment listing online. I am new to the city from South Carolina and their customer service and quick communication made the entire tour very informative. The building has impressive amenities, including a gym, a rooftop, and a lounge perfect for socializing. The proximity to downtown Manhattan is an ideal choice for anyone. I appreciate the transparency in telling me exactly what we are paying for when thinking of signing a lease. Overall, had a great experience touring Oriana thanks to Cai.

originalText.text: I am never one to write bad reviews but this one is absolutely justified. Don’t get me wrong, I liked living in the building but there were more cons than pros to living here. Firstly, the utility bill was utterly atrocious. It was around $600 a month. I have never ever paid so much in my life. In my last apartment it was at most $50. Secondly, the elevators were horrible. Not only did they take an eternity to arrive but they stop working sometimes while you are in them. During my first week of living in this building I was in an elevator and got stuck in it with this poor lady who was having a panic attack beside me. We were in there for 30 mins before anything happened. Thirdly, the management is horrible. They will only respond fast and be nice to you before you sign but after that.. forget about it. They will never answer your calls, actively try to avoid you and when you went down to the leasing office to speak to them they would say they were “too busy” to speak to you and to call them or email them instead. They are insanely RUDE. I can not stress this enough. They called my roommates and I multiple times accusing us of not paying rent when you can look in the system and see that we have in fact paid every month. Additionally, they were listing our apartment for 2K less than what we were paying so we asked for a price match and not only did they say NO, they signed away our apartment at that rate leaving us no choice but to leave. It’s also been over a month since we have moved out and we still haven’t gotten our security deposit back. This management does not care about keeping their existing tenants, I have never seen a turnover rate so high for a building. They will reel you in with the reasonable rent for one year and then double it the following year. If you are looking for somewhere to live for one year this is a good choice, if you are looking long term I advise you to look elsewhere.

originalText.text:
Worst building experience!!!! DONT LIVE HERE. The people at the leasing office are only nice until you book the property, and afterwards the bullying begins. Talking down to the tenants and the doormen constantly. Disgusting and derogatory behavior. I wonder how they haven’t been taken to court already for their behavior which goes against every building code and any persons MORALS.

Also, they delayed our security deposit refund for 2 months. Which is ILLEGAL.

Only good part is the amazing doormen who go above and beyond who deserve the utmost respect from the leasing office!!!!!

originalText.text: Me and my roommates recently had the pleasure of working with Oriana’s management team for an apartment listing, and the experience was exceptional. Their professionalism, attention to detail, and responsiveness made the entire process smooth and stress-free. I specifically appreciated working with Cai Lu, his transparency and honesty, making me feel confident in my decision. He took the time to answer all questions we had and explained all fees in detail so we knew exactly what we’re getting ourselves into. I highly recommend working with Cai Lu for any in search of a reliable and trustworthy leasing manager in their home search.

originalText.text: Great doormen. The building might be old, but most of the units have been recently renovated. It sits on a quiet street, not far from supermarkets, restaurant, and shops you need. Loved the neighborhood. The rooftop is breathtaking!
